paper_abstract: Let P be a set of n points in R(3), and let k <= n be an integer. A sphere sigma is k-rich with respect to P if vertical bar sigma boolean AND P vertical bar >= k, and is.-non-degenerate, for a fixed fraction 0 < eta < 1, if no circle gamma subset of sigma contains more than eta vertical bar sigma boolean AND P vertical bar points of P. We improve the previous bound given in [1] on the number of k-rich eta-non-degenerate spheres in 3-space with respect to any set of n points in R(3), from O(n(4)/k(5) + n(3)/k(3)), which holds for all 0 < eta < 1/2, to(1) O*(n(4)/k(11/2) + n(2)/k(2)), which holds for all 0 < eta < 1 (in both bounds, the constants of proportionality depend on eta). The new bound implies the improved upper bound O*(n(58/27)) approximate to O(n(2.1482)) on the number of mutually similar triangles spanned by n points in R(3); the previous bound was O(n(13/6)) approximate to O(n(2.1667)) [1].
